title: Was Louis Foyton a shepherd of "human animals " in the 19th and early 19th centuries?
subtitle: Although they were not usually billed this way, 'human zoos' were unfortunately something during the prestige of Western colonialism.
author: David Emery
vclaim: In the late 18th and early 19th centuries, Louis Foyton sponsored "human zoos," where blacks were displayed like strange circus animals.
